question: May your source code be used for commercial purposes?
yes: Your code may be included in other software, which is distributed for a charge (e.g. Eset NOD 32 Antivirus)
no: Your code may not be included in paid software, other people cannot sublicense your code for a charge.

children.label: yes
children.question: May your source code be included in proprietary software?
children.yes: If your code is included in such software, its owner has no duty to provide anyone the source code of his/her software. (e.g. Opera Browser)
children.no: If your code is included in such software, its owner is obliged to provide the source code of his/her software to anyone.

children.label: yes
children.question: If may, does your source code of such distributed software need to be disclosed?
children.yes: You may oblige other people to disclose source code of their own software if such software includes your own source code.
children.no: You may provide other people a freedom to solve: to disclose or not disclose the source code of their own software.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you allow to modify your source code
children.yes: Users of your code have a right to change it, make derivative software based on your code.
children.no: Users of your code do not have a right to change it or make derivative software. They have a right to use it only in the form which was received from you.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you require to mark made changes in case of modification?
children.yes: If somebody changes your code, he/she needs to state such changes (in any form, e.g. changelog, comments in source code, additional documentation file, etc.).
children.no: If somebody changes your code, he/she is not obliged to state such changes (in any form, e.g. changelog, comments in source code, etc.).

children.label: no
children.question: Do you allow to modify your source code
children.yes: Users of your code have a right to change it, make derivative software based on your code.
children.no: Users of your code do not have a right to change it or make derivative software. They have a right to use it only in the form which was received from you.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you require to mark made changes in case of modification?
children.yes: If somebody changes your code, he/she needs to state such changes (in any form, e.g. changelog, comments in source code, additional documentation file, etc.).
children.no: If somebody changes your code, he/she is not obliged to state such changes (in any form, e.g. changelog, comments in source code, etc.).

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you require to display your copyright on this source code, if it is included in other product
children.yes: If anyone uses your code, he/she is obliged to inform other users that he/she really use your code by providing the info about your copyright and license related to such your source code. See a link about:license in your Firefox browser as an examplle.
children.no: If anyone uses your code, he/she may (but is not obliged) to inform other users that he/she really use your code by providing the info about your copyright and license related to such your source code.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you wish to provide users with your source code on 'as is' basis (without any warranties)?
children.yes: You will provide a warranty to users of your code about its stability, errorless, commercial value, etc.
children.no: You will not provide any warranty to users of your code about its stability, errorless, commercial value, etc, and so, would not be liable for any its disadvantage.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you wish to limit your liability against users of your source code?
children.yes: You may limit your civil and monetary liability.
children.no: You are ready to be liable for any damages or losses of other people who use your code in accordance with applicable law.

children.label: no
children.question: Do you extremely need a short license?
children.yes: Some licenses have a short text, which is enough for many use cases by other people. But they do not usually cover specific use cases (e.g. trademark and patents rights).
children.no: You would like to cover by license text as many use cases as possible. And a long license text is not problem for you and your users.

children.label: no
children.question: Do you wish to require other users to distribute their product (with included your source code in it) under the same license terms as yours one?
children.yes: You chose a license. A user created a software and included your source code in it. You may obliged him/her to distribute such his/her software under the same license as your own one.
children.no: You chose a license. A user created a software and included your source code in it. You would like to provide such user a freedom of choice the license for his/her software.

children.label: no
children.question: Do you require to display your copyright on this source code, if it is included in other product
children.yes: If anyone uses your code, he/she is obliged to inform other users that he/she really use your code by providing the info about your copyright and license related to such your source code. See a link about:license in your Firefox browser as an examplle.
children.no: If anyone uses your code, he/she may (but is not obliged) to inform other users that he/she really use your code by providing the info about your copyright and license related to such your source code.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you wish to provide users with your source code on 'as is' basis (without any warranties)
children.yes: You will provide a warranty to users of your code about its stability, errorless, commercial value, etc.
children.no: You will not provide any warranty to users of your code about its stability, errorless, commercial value, etc, and so, would not be liable for any its disadvantage.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you wish to limit your liability against users of your source code
children.yes: You may limit your civil and monetary liability.
children.no: You are ready to be liable for any damages or losses of other people who use your code in accordance with applicable law.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you extremely need a short license?
children.yes: Some licenses have a short text, which is enough for many use cases by other people. But they do not usually cover specific use cases (e.g. trademark and patents rights).
children.no: You would like to cover by license text as many use cases as possible. And a long license text is not problem for you and your users.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you want to specify rules of your name usage to endorse or promote products derived from your source code?
children.yes: You would like to specify rules on references to you as owner of your source code for promoting purposes.
children.no: There is no necessity on references to you as owner of your source code for promoting purposes.

children.label: no
children.question: Do you wish require other users to distribute their product (with included your source code in it) under the same license terms as yours one?
children.yes: You chose a license. A user created a software and included your source code in it. You may obliged him/her to distribute such his/her software under the same license as your own one.
children.no: You chose a license. A user created a software and included your source code in it. You would like to provide such user a freedom of choice the license for his/her software.

children.label: no
children.question: Do you want to clearly specify in license text that you do not grant any trademark right related to your software?
children.yes: You would like to specify in the license that you do not grant your trademark rights.
children.no: You do not want to specify in the license that you do not grant your trademark rights.

children.label: yes
children.question: Do you need to receive an express grant of patent rights from your contributors?
children.yes: If you will receive patches and other contributions to your source code, you would like to receive patent rights from owners of such patches and contributions.
children.no: There is no necessity to receive patent rights from owners of patches and contributions to your software.
